intro: Plectrachne, commonly known as the grass of the genus Plectrachne, is a group of flowering plants in the grass family, Poaceae. These plants are typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, often in disturbed soils or along roadsides. They are characterized by their slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. Plectrachne species are generally herbaceous and have narrow, linear leaves. Due to their adaptability, they can thrive in various environmental conditions, making them common in many ecosystems.
